intro: Wikstroemia effusa, commonly known as the broadleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
